This website uses cookies

Signaturit Solutions SL uses its own and third-party cookies to personalize content and advertisements, offer social media functions and analyze traffic. In addition, we share information about your use of the website with our social media, advertising and analytics partners, who can combine it with other information that you have provided or that they have collected from the use you have made of their services. You can accept all cookies by clicking "Accept cookies." For more information about our cookies and their settings, see our [Cookies Policy.](https://www.signaturit.com/cookie-policy/)

FAQS
----

What is a shipment?

1 request is equivalent to sending 1 or more documents at the same time, as long as they are addressed to the same recipients. That request will be counted as 1 credit. We sometimes use the term “credits” to talk about requests – 1 request and 1 credit are the same thing. For example, if an employee within an onboarding process has to sign 3 separate documents, they can all be sent through a single shipment, both to the employee and to the legal representative. This would be counted as 1 credit.

What is a user?

The person who signs up with Signaturit to send documents for signing through our platform. With the Business+ plan, you can create work teams with several users.

Are electronic signatures legal?

Yes. The governing body for electronic signatures in the European Union is eIDAS (EU Regulation 910/2014). At Signaturit, we comply with the eIDAS and our company is recognised as a qualified electronic trust service provider by the Spanish Ministry of Economic Affairs and Digital Transformation. We also have the EU seal of trust.

How many shipments are used up in one submission?

In a signature request you can add up to 15 documents to be signed for a single signature credit. If there are multiple signers on the same set of documents, we also count a single signature credit from both the Dashboard and the API.

Do the signatories have to be registered in order to sign?

No. The signatory receives an email containing a link that they simply need to click on to access and sign the document. This can be done from a computer, tablet, or mobile device.

What is the difference between simple and advanced signatures?

Simple signatures are usually employed by checking a box or entering a PIN or OTP code to request a signature on a document. For example, to accept the terms and conditions on a website. This signature cannot uniquely identify the signer. Advanced electronic signatures do allow for the signer to be uniquely identified. At Signaturit, we offer two types of advanced signatures: biometrics (written signatures) and signatures with digital certificates issued by third parties. Both types of signatures are legal, but advanced signatures offer greater legal guarantees than simple signatures, because they can uniquely identify the signer.

How many documents can I send to be signed?

It depends on the plan you choose. The Business plan includes 60 documents per year, the Business + plan includes 240 documents per year, and the Enterprise plan includes an unlimited number of documents.

What is the process if more than one person needs to sign a document?

The second signatory will only receive the document to be signed after the first has completed the process. If there is a third signatory, they will receive it after the second has signed. And so on. The order of the signatories is established in the submission process.

Can I change my plan?

Yes, you can switch plans easily in your management portal, at any time you choose.

What is a batch submission?

This feature allows you to send a document to many people at the same time. Each signatory will receive the document to sign in their email.
